pain.t.fx_2021

Class OpenAndSaveMethods

  • java.lang.Object
    • pain.t.fx_2021.OpenAndSaveMethods

  • public class OpenAndSaveMethods
extends java.lang.Object

    Methods for saving to and opening from a file

    Runner object in PainTFX_2021.java can be called to implement methods based on opening and saving files
    Since:
    2021-10-11

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      OpenAndSaveMethods(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
      Constructor that records data about the stage for dialog

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void fileChooseOpen(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Event Handler method for Open File MenuItem in MenuPain Uses file selector to put image file in current tab Calls TabPain#canvasInit()
      void fileChooseOpenNewTab(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Event Handler method for Open File New Tab MenuItem in MenuPain Uses file selector to put image file in current tab Calls TabPain#canvasInit()
      void filePubDomOpen(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Event Handler method for Open Public Domain Image MenuItem in MenuPain Checks user.dir for MA.JPG Loads image into current tab Calls TabPain#canvasInit()
      void keyboardOpenFileAndSave(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      Event Handler method for PainTFX_2021 Detects whether user input Open File or Save File Open File uses file selector to put image file in current tab Save File checks for the tab's default path and throws an error if missing Calls LoggingThread#logSave() Calls TabPain#canvasInit()
      void saveDestChosen(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Event Handler method for Save As MenuItem in MenuPain Saves current canvas data to the file location selected by user Calls LoggingThread#logSave() Calls TabPain#canvasInit()
      void saveGeneric(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Event Handler method for Save MenuItem in MenuPain Saves current canvas data to the file location in current tab Throws dialog if no file location data is recorded Calls LoggingThread#logSave() Calls TabPain#canvasInit()
